17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

there were 5 of father mother 1 brother & myself
1 one sister
breakfast porridge made of ground wheat
dinner potatoes one other kind of vegetable sometimes
meat bread & butter
supper bread & milk sometimes boiled wheat with
milk & no sugar

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Eastern Canada? ...................... Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

I don't remember much about Ontario as I was only 6 years old when we came west to stay in 1885. My father helped to build the CPR as far as Waskesiy.

yes some times we did not have many flows
especially in the winter time in 1886 & 7 we
were 14 miles from town & had only ocean
& the snow on the level was about 4 or 5 feet
deep & no roads through would be as low as 50
below at times

20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

There is no comparison now to the early days when we had to grow nearly everything you ate now you can get nearly everything in cans or in packages but everything is so high in price.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

I never bought foods purchased as I had always canned food so we always had plenty we farmed & had lots of garden stuff after I was married in 1895.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].

After 1978 we were able to buy stuff in larger quantities apples by the barrel price about 300 per barrel grapes in 10 lbs Cans at a cost of 50 cents per 10 lbs fruit raisins in boxes of 25 lbs the price 5 cents rambo currants prunes red rose tea 3 lb for 100 a can 3 bars of royal crown soap for 25 cents bars toilet soap 25 cents 20 lb sack of meal we got over wheat ground into flour at white wood it cost 15 cents to grind it per bushel.
There is no compensation now to the early days or to hold to grow nearly every thing in Cans or in the cellar. Such every thing is so high in price.

When did you begin to rely on preserved foods instead of home grown and home prepared foods? Instead of canned goods (1915) I rely on many details and daves as possible.

I must have bought foods purchased as I had always canned food so we always had plenty we farmed & had tubs of as close stuff after I was married in 1895.
